intro: Gouldia ovata var. makawaoensis, commonly known as the Makawao gouldia, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
